unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue aggressive expansion of their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) networks across India, aiming to connect millions of households to high-speed internet. The rollout, driven by rising demand for bandwidth-intensive services like streaming and online education, is transforming the Indian telecommunications landscape.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue aggressive expansion of their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) networks across India, aiming to connect millions of households to high-speed internet. The rollout, driven by rising demand for bandwidth-intensive services like streaming and online education, is transforming the Indian telecommunications landscape.

unnormalised: Dr. Anil Sharma, a telecom analyst at IIT Delhi, noted the significant impact of FTTH on rural connectivity, bridging the digital divide. "These initiatives are crucial for empowering smaller towns and villages with access to the same opportunities as urban centers," he stated.
normalised: Doctor Anil Sharma, a telecom analyst at I I T Delhi, noted the significant impact of F T T H on rural connectivity, bridging the digital divide. "These initiatives are crucial for empowering smaller towns and villages with access to the same opportunities as urban centers," he stated.

unnormalised: Airtel recently announced the connection of over 1 million homes in Rajasthan, while Jio plans to cover an additional 50,000 km in Uttar Pradesh by year-end. The investments, amounting to Rs. 5000 Crores combined, are creating numerous jobs. The average Indian household now consumes approximately 200 GB of data per month, driving demand for faster connections. Developers are also incorporating FTTH infrastructure into new residential projects, with some offering pre-installed connectivity in apartments ranging from 800 sq ft to 1200 sq ft.
normalised: Airtel recently announced the connection of over one million homes in Rajasthan, while Jio plans to cover an additional fifty thousand kilometer in Uttar Pradesh by year-end. The investments, amounting to rupee five thousand crores combined, are creating numerous jobs. The average Indian household now consumes approximately two hundred G B of data per month, driving demand for faster connections. Developers are also incorporating F T T H infrastructure into new residential projects, with some offering pre-installed connectivity in apartments ranging from eight hundred square feet to one thousand two hundred square feet.
